headline: Applied Materials flags $600 million revenue hit in 2026 on broader chip export curbs
summary: Shares of Applied Materials fell about 3% in extended trading on Thursday after the company said in a filing the new rule would make it more difficult to export some products and supply specific parts and services to select China-based customers without a license.  The U.S. Department of Commerce on Monday widened the export blacklist to include majority-owned subsidiaries of listed companies, cracking down on companies in China and other countries that use units and affiliates to circumvent certain U.S. export curbs.  Applied Materials also expects an impact of about $110 million on fourth-quarter revenue.

The U.S. Department of Commerce on Monday widened the export blacklist to include majority-owned subsidiaries of listed companies, cracking down on companies in China and other countries that use units and affiliates to circumvent certain U.S. export curbs.  Applied Materials also expects an impact of about $110 million on fourth-quarter revenue.

headline: Applied Materials Expects $710 Million Revenue Hit From New Export Rule
summary: The company said new export restrictions published by the Bureau of Industry and Security would restrict its ability to export certain products to China-based customers without a license.

raw.headline: Applied Materials Expects $710 Million Revenue Hit From New Export Rule
raw.summary: The company said new export restrictions published by the Bureau of Industry and Security would restrict its ability to export certain products to China-based customers without a license.

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Outpaces Stock Market Gains: What You Should Know
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) reached $223.59 at the closing of the latest trading day, reflecting a +2.69% change compared to its last close.

headline: Applied Materials Warns of Sales Hit From Latest Curbs on China
summary: The US Commerce Department’s Bureau of Industry and Security has issued a new rule this week that widens the range of companies subject to export restrictions, Applied Materials said in a regulatory filing Thursday.  Shares of the Santa Clara, California-based company fell as much as 5.6% in extended trading following the announcement.  Applied Materials and its peers have faced increasingly strict rules governing their ability to supply and support customers in China.

Applied Materials and its peers have faced increasingly strict rules governing their ability to supply and support customers in China.

headline: Entegris, Applied Materials, Photronics, and Impinj Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after OpenAI announced partnerships with South Korean firms SK Hynix and Samsung for its ambitious 'Stargate' AI infrastructure project, signaling massive future demand for advanced chips.

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Is Up 8.1% After Record Q3 Revenue and New AI Photonics Partnership
summary: Applied Materials reported record-breaking third quarter fiscal 2025 revenue with an 8% year-on-year rise, alongside a robust operating margin of 30.6%, and announced a new partnership with GlobalFoundries to advance AI-driven photonics through a state-of-the-art waveguide fabrication facility in Singapore. This partnership highlights Applied’s active role in enabling next-generation semiconductor and photonics technologies, reinforcing its relevance in shaping the industry's future...

headline: Energy Transition Update - Floating Offshore Wind Poised For Major Growth By 2030
summary: The global floating offshore wind energy market is projected to experience significant growth from $1.7 billion in 2025 to $18 billion by 2030, with a compound annual growth rate of 60.1%, according to a BCC Research study. This surge is attributed to advancements in technology, cost reductions, and increased interest in integrated engineering solutions. The sector is positioned to play a key role in the global transition to sustainable energy, overcoming the limitations of fixed-bottom...

headline: SMH: AI Bubble? Chip Stocks Are Rewriting History
summary: The VanEck Semiconductor ETF remains a Buy as semiconductor demand surges, with inventory levels dropping and sales outpacing supply. Learn more about SMH ETF here.

headline: 1 Cash-Heavy Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 That Underwhelm
summary: A surplus of cash can mean financial stability, but it can also indicate a reluctance (or inability) to invest in growth. Some of these companies also face challenges like stagnating revenue, declining market share, or limited scalability.
